intro: Eriochloa parvispiculata, commonly known as small-bristle panicgrass, is a species of grass native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense,丛生 (clumped) foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with minute, bristled lemma hairs, which are typical of the grass family Poaceae. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
